intro: Mystroxylon oligocarpum, commonly known as the golden burl, is a member of the Burseraceae family and is native to parts of Central and South America. It is a small, deciduous tree characterized by its smooth, light-colored bark and distinctive golden-brown burls. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers and is known for its aromatic resins, which have been used traditionally in various cultural practices. Its botanical features make it an important species in tropical ecosystems, though it is relatively rare and faces conservation challenges.
